text: [Music]
I guess I start
with what's written on the subject I I
just sort of do do do research have
there been newspaper articles have there
been other magazine articles now one of
the tricks with New Yorker stories is
you want to pick a story that is
familiar enough that people will want to
read about it but not so familiar that
they feel like they already know
everything and they don't want to read a
whole long New Yorker story so usually
when I pick a subject there's some stuff
written about it but not a
ton
and then when I feel like I sort of know
what the issues are I kind of work
around the edges of the story first I'll
often talk to say with me it's often a
law professor who's familiar with the
story who can sort of outline what the
what's at stake you know what's
interesting what's what's what's the hot
controversy about it and then maybe I'll
start to talk to more peripheral
peripheral players in the story and only
at the end or the at least the end of
the beginning will I try to interview
the protagonists because I think in
order to ask good questions you have to
know a lot about the subject to start
with so I am a great believer in
not going to the main characters first
because I need to educate myself about
it so I can ask the right questions and
then it's often just a matter of finding
scenes you know I often think of New
Yorker stories in terms
of set pieces in terms of you know
watching something happen as as a reader
and thus as a writer so how can I go and
see if I'm WR a profile see the
person you know interact give orders
give a speech
perform be backstage just sort of how
can I dramatize the story one one thing
that I I I always worry about I mean I I
is that I am in the business usually of
writing stories that have issues at
their core you know is uh uh is Alberto
Gonzalez doing his job as as attorney
general uh you know what are we going to
do about autonomo the challenge is to
take those issues and turn them into
stories people want to
read the the I always want a story to be
a narrative you know here's here's how
it started and their complications
ensued and here's how it ended that so
so that you know it takes you along with
you that it can't just be about an
abstraction and and that that's a tug I
often feel so in in my reporting I'm
always thinking about how do I make this
into a story and how do I in the famous
journalistic instruction how do I show
don't tell how do I show things
happening rather than just sort of
explain
[Music]
